intro: Physurus elatior, commonly known as the showy bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the family Lentibulariaceae, which includes many carnivorous plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wet, marshy environments and has a short growing season. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
